LBwAPtOGg8YvhKvYzOIANA.text: Love this new place! The atmosphere is really nice and the food is awesome! All the staff are super helpful and Sam, the GM made a point to welcome us and kept checking in. Our new favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Angry Lobster Roll.. yummy!

TNg70CIrPvKXxjm5HFFwXA.text: Just landed from a flight and was in the mood to go for some sushi, looked on yelp and saw that this place looked good and had great reviews. First thing we ordered were the oysters and from the first bite we had a idea that this was going to be a bad experience. Fresh oysters are a must and these were nothing but subpar. The ceviche was too fishy to eat. Ikira with quail egg wasn't great. After that we had a simple tuna and albacore sushi I took one bite of the tuna and that was it. If you are going to serve raw fish please make sure it is FRESH! We even asked the server to try to show him that we are not just saying that to eat for free he refused. When we send back the remainder of the food they still wanted to charge us. And then the cashier "manager" on duty told us she couldn't do anything she needed to call the owner. Where at that point the owner on the phone asked what gender were we. Strange ? Odd? Then proceeded to give us 15% off. YAY. Do not be fooled by the yelp reviews for this place. We came from the Belagio all the way here to have 4.5 star sushi and we got nothing better than a 1. Smh to this place!! Yelp should investigate these reviews or maybe these "elite" members have 0 experience with real sushi.

2J_RTJg6Om-ZgSn29mB8Kg.text: The worst sushi I've ever had. The food was not fresh at all and the worst thing you can do is have not fresh fish. Stay away at all costs. I'm contacting the Nevada health board to come inspect their food before someone really ends up sick from their food

t5RbHx0JtXlkApv2hOiihA.text: Came here for some small bites a little after the dinner time on their first week of opening.   First, the overall vibe of the restaurant was very modern and chic. I certainly want to give them the credit for their sense in  restaurant interior. We were seated right away by the hostess, and our server greeted us promtly. The service overall was on point.   However, their food did not meet my expectations at all. Their ceviche was not cold, and it did not have the classic flavor that I have had before. Their salmon skin salad was very bland. The server mentioned that the chefs were from Nobu. I did not see any quality of Nobu from this restaurant's menu. Maybe it's because I didn't try anything from their signature menu page, but I doubt I good they can be when the basics of a Japanese restaurant menu is not satisfying ( at least to me).   Their price is definitely a little above average from similar businesses around them. Their menu seems to overlap a lot with other local restaurants, but prices are more of strip restaurants. Will I come back? Not so sure, but might give them a try for their signature dish in the future for a second chance.

JV7j6lzSRQDCVCkAlM_Wuw.text: I'm on the fence between a 3 and 4 star so I had to go with the 3. If there was a 3.5 that's what it would be. Service just ok. My appetizer (cucumber salad) came then my lunch entree (sushi burrito) right behind it. Then a little while later part of my daughters food came. BUT NO WATERS had still been brought. (Had to ask agsin for waters) Then other half of her food came. I was almost done with my food when her food came. I just really get bothered when this kind of thing happens. If we come together to eat we obviously like to eat together. After we were done eating and our waters were empty we were finally asked if we wanted more water. Food was good not great. We might give it another try down the road  But not for a while till they get the customer service stuff together.

o6OOHw0l87oU49NTjaN7Tg.text: I can't say enough about this place. I do have Celiacs disease (severe gluten intolerance) and it is hard at times to dine out. Naomi has been our waitress both times my boyfriend and I have gone. Not only is she knowledgeable but one of the best servers I've ever encountered. The food is outstanding to boot and comes out so beautiful, it looks like art. I love the open kitchen concept. Ask about their specials they have, you will not be disappointed.....and for those of you with gluten intolerances, they have Tamari and will create your dishes with that instead of soy sauce!!! Thank you everyone over at Pier 215 for having me and taking care of me!

h--UPpNv6K9TlZ7XZA1o9g.text: The food is fresh and very good with excellent flavor. The prices and portion size are perfect. They have lunch specials.

gtfkGyoCwQPEHPlWjmeJTQ.text: Had an awesome experience here. We basically got a bunch of small plates, things from the raw bar, sushi, wine and sake. We liked everything we got! The sushi quality was great, the service was awesome (Kevin), and it had a nice atmosphere about it. Definitely one of the better places I've been to in Vegas.

n3PKye8foXxjw3FDQckLyQ.text: My friend wanted sushi and I suggested this place because I always drive past it and wanted to check it out. I called and asked about there happy hour which is from 3-6. The restaurant is really nice perfect for a date night. We came strictly for happy hour, I was very dissatisfied by the lack luster menu options they offered. For starters they only have discounted beer and wine which I don't care for either. So I had to knock a star for that. There weren't many food options which was a let down as well. There were no sushi rolls! How can a sushi spot not have any rolls on the happy hour menu? We ended up getting the garlic edemame which was amazing, raw oysters and shrimp which was pretty good. My friend ordered a crab crunch roll off the regular menu and it was mediocre to say the least. Lacked in flavor and super plain. From the pictures I've seen on yelp they seem to have other good options we just didn't get a chance to try them. The service was decent not good or bad. I'll come back another time to try the regular menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lack luster happy hour menu
Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab crunch roll was meh skip this
Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp

47uHsTvUO0O8txRMVJfrEg.text: The food is spectacular. Presentation, quality, taste, and temperature... Practically perfect. Our main gripe? Service. The servers for the other tables seemed good though. It was just ours.  The place wasn't busy for an early Saturday evening. We had reservations for 6:30, but didn't need them. There were only a couple other parties seated when we entered. We were greeted and seated promptly and our server introduced herself.  She mentioned cocktail hour, so we ordered a whiskey sour. It only had a splash of whiskey. Turns out, it was NOT cocktail hour. Knowing this, I got the Blissful Sakura anyway because it sounded good. It was tasty, but only had a hint of sake. I'm a light weight and don't like the taste of alcohol... And I liked the drinks. They don't put much alcohol in them.  My selection of oysters arrived and they were delicious. Crisp and sweet.  We then waited 30 minutes for our entrees. Our server had forgotten our shared appetizer. That's a really long wait, especially when there aren't very many parties seated.  At this point, I discovered that they had specials. I heard about them from the server at the table behind us and they sounded great, but too late. I do wish our server had told us about them.  When our dinners arrived, we were both pleasantly surprised and impressed. The server for the table behind us had been explaining each dish while ours didn't, so I asked him about one of the sashimi selections on my plate because it was just so good. So much so that I ended up ordering another one of those a la carte. (Something something yellowtail, not the regular yellowtail, although I'm sure that's good, too. It's translucent white with pink edges. Very, VERY good.)  We opted to skip dessert and when the check came, it was incorrect.  We wanted to like the place. The food is worth coming for. We just got unlucky with the service.

aAiDCQg0_2T192CFZ76V8Q.text: Had dinner here earlier for the first time and it was great. Once we found the place, it was a bit hard to distinguish if it was open or not due to the sun directly hitting the windows so we couldn't see any open sign or anyone coming in or out of the restaurant. Once we realized it was open, we were good to go.   Service was good. Cleared plates as soon as we were done. Drinks were brought out quickly. The sushi rolls were yummy. A bit pricey as they don't offer all you can eat.   Great view once nightfall hit. Can see the city lights. Romantic.   Would I come here again? Yes if I'm in the area. :)

RjdxK8o0BH6zYMB3vGYcZA.text: No AYCE, which means you can expect good quality sushi-Come with those expectations because they will certainly be met! Everything that we had for dinner from the oysters, sushi rolls, kimchi inspired soup and the risotto, my words alone cannot do it justice so I will upload photos soon ;)  I can't write about Pier 215 without mentioning the interior. It's a perfect place for a small business dinner or date. From the moment you step inside there is dim lighting that is done by low hanging lightbulbs in the center of the dining room. The corners of the restaurant has neat decorations like a small lighthouse, baskets full of decor and more. The decorations really ties in the place together.  The oysters were smaller than the ones I'm used to but I can't stress enough about the freshness and quality. They were amazing and I'm not even a big oyster fan. My favorite by far was the salmon risotto. I was very impressed by the risotto and the sauce.  Like I said, it's all a la carte so don't expect a small penny for your meal. It'll cost you but in my opinion it's worth it. I just love the level of quality you can literally taste as opposed to regular ayce sushi. Will definitely visit again.

LxL-cAWVeBdDRTFgOC_I7w.text: 5 stars for the cute atmosphere & local japanese spot and also the delicious and most beautiful sashimi platter i've tried outside the Las Vegas strip.  I found a new place for my sashimi cravings. Went 2 days in a row, dinner for a birthday and the next day lunch because the platter for 5 people wasn't enough for me when I had to share it.  Fried Ebi heads were crunchy and tasty, Toro had caviar with truffle, and they also serve the platter with fresh wasabi.   Only negative I would say is dinner they forgot my hot tea, and the next day lunch they forgot my half dozen chefs choice oysters, I forget things too slow & busy times when I'm serving on the strip.  Sorry Soho I like Pier 215's sashimi platter better. Double the price but double the sashimi. Very fresh!

photos.caption: Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Premium Sashimi Platter

oifDqe1JsIswSpfdiWjKVA.text: Just came here for desserts and drinks and it was great! This place has a good atmosphere and is not too loud for conversation. Jan was our server and was so polite and helpful.

b58LjCDkBFtb-QwHi7PhYg.text: Like being in San Francisco but when you look outside it's desert landscaping lol. Super cute. My clients loved the spot. Food was solid and not too expensive. Had the sashimi lunch special. My friend had rolls and it looked pretty legit. Kitchen looked like it had asian sushi chefs.

lnYzBsi83KRg_1btifMSSg.text: Beautiful fresh lovely sushi place here.  Definitely coming back.  I recommend the ahi tuna avocado rice bowl, yum

photos.caption: Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty view

UIN_CR1RgNhgP08q-XAUTQ.text: Pier 215 is our neighborhood date-night restaurant. We love the vibe of this place, the food is not only tasty but it presented beautifully, and they have a great wine selection. Don't forget- half price bottles of wine on Tuesday nights! You can find me there drinking my Rombauer Chard!  I have had several sushi rolls, Japanese pickles, edamame, and teppanaki. All delicious. Believe it or not the pasta is amazing here too! The spicy shrimp pasta and the scallop risotto are both my favorites. I can't say enough great things about this restaurant. I hope they stay open and are successful for a very long time!

photos.caption: Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 215 Roll $21.50 beautiful, filling, and delicious!

0vTY-_mCZlvU4V0SsVTwqQ.text: This place has the best Sushi, great service. Right off of Durango and 215. Good service. I recommend it!  Heard about from a friend that had dinner here and bragged about it. Now it's my turn to brag. Hope you take my advice and stop by for a bite.  -Rob.

photos.caption: Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7khXaXRUXHL49AcU_E6kKg.text: If you're looking for something new and refreshing both atmosphere and food quality Pier 215 is the restaurant to go to!  It's like an oasis away from Vegas, a restaurant that reminds me of Santa Monica or the Bay Area all that's missing is an ocean view!  My family and I ordered a plethora of food ranging from tapas to sushi to pasta and salad and all of them were amazing!  Personally, I ordered the Cajun shrimp vodka penne pasta and it's quality was phenomenal! The shrimp was fresh and the vodka sauce had a kick to it but it was all around tasty!

HLAktEDvL32vFkMRy3Zlvg.text: I've been here numerous times and it's always so amazing. I've  had the mixed green salad(love the dressing), snapper carpaccio(who can say no to truffle?), tenderloin tobanyaki, chicken wings(so crispy), chicken fettuccine (weird to have at an Asian place but it was still delicious!) and the most tasty item of all was when I went in tonight and had the special sea bass with soy beurre blanc sauce. Honestly if that was a regular menu item I would go there wayyy more often than I do now! It was the best fish dish I've ever eaten. It was so good I had to write a review lol

photos.caption: Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea bass special  Amazing!

hnlk5ukQdmDY--Lv99CT7w.text: The atmosphere in the restaurant is excellent. Perfect place for a night out and the view is great. The menu, yelp and all these reviews definitely got our hopes up too high. For the price and the atmosphere we expected the food to live up to it. Items we ordered were the braised short ribs, the bouillabase, the baked crab roll, shrimp and walnut salad, hamachi kama, green tea creme brulee, and also the nutella crunch cake.  My husband always tends to gear towards braised short ribs any chance he gets. So if its on a menu he'd order it. Of all the braised  short rib dishes we have tried this definitely was our least favorite. The presentation is a little lacking and the meat was on the dry side. The flavor was decent and tasted like korean bbq. But I guess we were looking for that succulent fall off the bone short rib and it just wasnt what we expected at all.   Next we have the bouillabase... it was definitely not worth $27. Honestly it felt like some mixed seafood in a tomato soup. Presentation was a little lacking. I expected it to be a little more elegant. The flavors were fine but it didnt taste as special as I thought it would.   The baked crab roll was great! It was my favorite part of the meal! My only complaint is that once it arrived I could already tell it wasn't made with premium sushi rice(round and fluffy. It was really good but couldve been better.   The hamachi kama I dont really have any complaints. It was what I expected and what you would get at other places.  Walnut shrimp salad... the flavors were really good but it wasn't special.   Then came dessert and we really enjoyed both the creme brulee and the nutella crunch cake. The creme brulee was perfect but the nutella crunch cake I expected it to have more nutella flavor, still good though.   Overall... we had a really good time. Food was okay and service was spectacular.

photos.caption: Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea creme brulee
Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamachi kama
Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood bouillabase

w4sYwJmmPljBbfSmakQqTQ.text: The space is wonderful. Very unique view of the valley. Service was excellent. The GM was here and engaged with us. Bacon asparagus = awesome.  Sushi appeared be fresh and was tasty.  I will return to explore the menu further - I'm especially eying the drag oysters.  The lunch sushi combo plate was a great value. Over 10 sakes on the menu.

sMxccATIPuAecmbgZSq6XA.text: This brand new place has a nice aesthetic and modern flare. I discovered it while waiting for the crowds to thin out at IKEA on opening day Lol.  I ordered from the lunch menu and it ended up being a ton of food. I received soup, many pieces of sushi, sashimi salad, a roll and a tempura bowl for a reasonable price. Top it off with a fresh cold Sappora beer and I was in heaven. Fat AF but in heaven.  It was so good that I went back 2 more times and ordered the exact same thing. I'm not saying this place is cheap or affordable. I'm saying it's a great price for the pristine quality and presentation.

photos.caption: Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thats a lot of food.
Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi salad.
Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All of it was great.

gzWFq32bDc9mVjquTRWuCg.text: Staff was super friendly my wife and I are picky when it comes to good sushi and wow were we happy with all the food 10/10

xnhO4SmEAMhfiSyUWfFeeg.text: Our favorite spot for late night happy hour! Those fresh oysters are bomb digs...the fried cheesecake is to die for!

qPTW1ASDHjamTH9C2XCH3g.text: I came for lunch with a friend. She got the lunch special. I got the chili edamame for a starter. I tried two different sushi rolls. The ahi tuna and the angry lobster. Both were amazing! I want to come back to try the chicken katsu! I'm glad she recommended it! High quality sushi at a reasonable price.

w2Tco7h8ihZYOE4FAY1qaA.text: There are a few asian fusion type of dishes on the menu but I wouldn't describe Pier 215 as a fully fusion restaurant bc there were mainly Japanese and some Korean dishes on the menu. The interior is clean and is decorated with string lights. It's nice for a couple or group dinner bc you can share.   My favorites were the Japanese snapper carpaccio and hamachi Kama. The sauce in the carpaccio was delicious and the cuts were a good size. The hamachi was large and came with a great sauce as well. I'd definitely order both again. Other highlights were the yellowtail jalapeno salsa and Asian bouillabaisse. The bouillabaisse soup was a little sweet. I wish it was a little spicy but still really good. We also tried one of their sushi roll specials that came with a big avocado crab ball and some nigiri. I'd skip the sushi rolls and nigiri next time. Although they were decently priced, it was similar quality to all you can eat sushi places so might as well try other items. The o-toro was thin and probably the worst I've had in Las Vegas. It was chewy and not the texture that I'm used to.

XWSjn7mb_nMpApmcQl8uRA.text: 5 stars absolutely amazing service. The chef deserves a big thank you . Came in around noon for lunch with my coworkers who ordered the  chicken teriyake combo . We were starving and I  ordered Korean Short ribs and fish and chips. Will definitely be coming back. 5 stars all around. Will brag to my friends about this place !

aoTO_xEOGLFhXPy8SA26uA.text: This is in my neighborhood and have been meaning to try it for quite sometime.  Popped in for lunch on Christmas Eve.  They do have a lunch specials menu but were not serving it for the holidays.  We wanted sushi anyway.  The roll selection is small but what great combinations.  Too often the long list of rolls can get overwhelming and it feels like you are getting the same offerings.  We ordered the veggie roll, crispy tuna, salmon sashimi and the salmon fiesta rolls.  All were very fresh tasting...the salmon was as melt in your fresh as it gets.  In the vast selection of eats down in the SW..this is a fantastic addition.

photos.caption: Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FkILyuFgdZf792XWGqdduQ.text: Date night done right... Anyone looking for that special spot to take your significant other? Well look no further than Pier 215. I can't believe this place has been hidden off of Durango for two years, just under my nose.  The wife and I were researching on Yelp for a nice new sushi place we haven't tried yet and this won the search, after perusing the nice pictures fellow Yelpers added. We did see there were drink specials Sunday through Thursday in case a Happy Hour is in your future.  We began with some water and a couple signature cocktails: The Confused One and the Piers View both delicious and refreshing. To start we ordered the Yellowtail jalapeno salsa with micro cilantro and ponzu sauce 5/5. Great tasting even if you don't like raw fish.  Oysters seem to be calling the wife's name so we sampled a few of the Kumamoto oysters with horseradish, Tabasco and vinegar 5/5, very fresh. I had to try a few salmon nigiri which are always good. Then we tried the crunchy roll which was unique with the tiny crunch balls atop the delicious roll 5/5. Time for another signature cocktail, the Blissful Sakura, again very delicious. For the entree we shared the Pan Seared Scallop served atop brown rice risotto, very filling and prepared well 4/5 (would have been 5/5 but the last scallop was a bit sandy). The risk you take when enjoying shellfish.   For dessert, I thought we had enough room for two; so we ordered the Crispy Cheese Cake and the Nutella Crunch Cake. The deep fried cheesecake came out first and hit the ball out of the park! This was so good I wish we ordered two! A definite 5/5. The Nutella came shortly after and lacked the "crunch" in its name and tasted more like chocolate cake than Nutella (coming from Europe we LOVE Nutella). A miss on this one, stick to the deep fried goodness!  Sean was a great server, very attentive and made good suggestions. Will be back again, found a new date night spot.

Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep fried crispy cheesecake! OMG 5/5

1idboadsn7ZAY7-2ET1GcQ.text: Husband and I stopped in on my first official day as a Nevada resident.   We immediately liked the atmosphere and decor. Our server Kevin, was friendly and thorough.  Throughout our meal, our drinks were quickly refilled without asking and he checked in on us often. The manager, Emily, stopped by our table to check on us and was sweet and engaging.  The food was fabulous and of a good assortment.  Price was a little high but we didn't mind because this was a special day for me. A must recommend!

sBnP1LrkM007FVcE5feNAQ.text: This place is amazing! The food is simply delicious and the service is second to none. My husband and I celebrated our anniversary last night and the entire meal, I kept telling my husband, "wow.. this food is delicious!"  Our server (I apologize I didn't get his name) was absolutely knowledgeable of EVERYTHING. I told him I didn't want a sweet drink and he suggested a drink called "Confused One". I ordered it and it was not sweet at all.  My husband asked for a white wine suggestion, something that wasn't sweet but not dry either and Dr Loosen was suggested. It was a perfect pair to the seabass, which was also highly recommended.  Pier 215 is definitely a new favorite if ours and will definitely be back. Thanks for the spectacular wedding anniversary dinner!

7BfaW9aoTsZUSFDKY_SYUA.text: Great place for an afternoon lunch or happy hour! I've had quite a few rolls, some fried calamari and drinks here. I haven't found anything I don't like! The fish is fresh and the presentation is always stunning. Their unagi bowl is huge and packed with delicately grilled unagi. The happy hour rolls are all delicious with a nice mix of raw and cooked rolls for any in the group that prefer one to the other. The drinks are exquisite and quite affordable during happy hour. The restaurant is elegant with a casual vibe and contemporary decor. The beautiful staff are just as friendly as can be and are very accommodating to coworkers splitting checks!

q0PI6NitUEF22160EJyODA.text: Overall amazing- Fantastic Food Quality!!!!!   Found this place on yelp and gave it a shot, will for sure come again as we had a wonderful experience   Parking- plenty  Kid friendly- they even had clean high chairs, and a special plate for the kids. No kids menu though but the chicken teriyaki was perfect for two kids to split.   THE FOOD- was seriously some of the best sushi I've had in a long time. We are Yellowtail Siracha roll, Crunchy roll and baked crab. All 3 were excellent! The miso soup was some of the best I've ever had. I also tried a bite of the kids door both the chicken teriyaki and fried zucchini were delicious too.

HQEKMEWzlXpoWzu63KNtOQ.text: Excellent! My husband and I went for date night on a Friday. We ordered shishito peppers, salmon roe, salmon skin salad, cucumber salad, kimchi, Japanese pickles and spicy tuna crispy rice bites. My husband also had oysters. We shared everything and it was so good. We left feeling full but not too heavy. Everything was light a full of flavor. Service was great and the manager Emily came by to welcome us and make sure everything was on point.

photos.caption: Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

svTLvp4yoMXfT8zeqsMPmw.text: Service is friendly, but the price is too steep for food that can be hit-or-miss. Here's the lowdown ~   I RECOMMEND: -- Uni Nigiri. It looked great and tasted fresh. -- Rock Shrimp aka one of the best orders of honey walnut shrimp I've ever had. The batter was unbelievably light and crispy, the sauce was balanced, and the cranberries were a great addition.  I'D SKIP: -- Chu Toro. It looked sloppy and it was average quality. -- Beef Teriyaki Lunch Special. It comes with a lot, but it wasn't done well. Both the teriyaki and the salad dressing had too much of a raw onion flavor that was overpowering. The tempura was not much better. The batter was too heavy, while the vegetables had too much bite.  CLOSE RUNNER UPS: -- Clam Miso Soup with mushrooms. While good, I don't think the quality justified the price. -- Sashimi Rice Bowl Lunch Special. Presentation-wise, it was beautiful with the different colors of different fish, ikura, micro greens, and radish. Flavor was decent and fish quality was average.  Overall, this place was just okay. I expect better quality for the price, and the food here is too hit-or-miss to have me rushing back.

AVKlJCn29xZLB9aA_wn_OQ.text: This was such a cute place for a nice date, not so much for family and children. Had dinner with my brother's family with 2 children.  The menu was a nice change to the area and offered a variety of dishes. One thing that was disappointing was the portion size. Like i said this is not a family oriented restaurant so multiple orders and not feeling full from satisfaction is what led to the 4 stars.  Overall a nice restaurant for dates and decent seafood.

rWPUn1vwzctN04qOtRt5hQ.text: Wanted to do a Happy Hour and ended up here from a friend who recommended it. The food was delicious and service was pleasant. Our favorite dishes from the HH menu were the ceviche and the oysters. The oysters were big and tasty. The ceviche has the right tang and we couldn't get enough.

FPsO9MpA9JMsJcwETBb-dQ.text: I've been wanting to try this place for some time now, on a turn around trip I decided to stop by on my way to the airport and I'm glad I did. I had the Two Fifteen Roll which was insanely good and also some salmon, Amberjack and yellowtail nigiri that was very fresh and delicious. The atmosphere in this place is very chill and the service was a spectacular. I will definitely stop by again when I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon, Amberjack and Yellowtail nigiri was delicious!!!
Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This roll is called the Two Fifteen Roll and it&#39;s amazing

_OlS6qiNRbc1X2BseoBjYg.text: I love Pier 215. Been coming pretty regularly. Always fresh, good service, great food.

cWU4AdA_u1vhJnVX4xoXPw.text: I've been here about 6 times now and I discovered this place literally only a month ago. I've tried so many sushi places that aren't AYCE because they're higher quality and this ended up being my favorite! Took my whole family here too and they agreed! They have the freshest sushi's that melt in your mouth with no fishy after taste at all!   I LOVE the yellowtail handroll! 5 bucks for that whole thing and everything else is pretty affordable! Their rolls are SO GOOD and so cheap! My family of 5 ate here and we were so full in the end and our bill came out to about 100 flat! That's less than if we had AYCE! Probably because the rolls are actually big and generous for the size!   They serve many other things too and their beef teriyaki bowl is SO GOOD! You can share it and it's only about 12 bucks! They serve good quality oysters and tapas as well. I'm really just wowed by the price range here for the quality of the food. It's too good!!!  The service here is also awesome! They're always so nice! It gets busy though so order up! The place looks great with the cute lights on the ceiling making if have like a Cali vibe in there!   I loveeeee this place so so so SO much! And I'm coming back next week ofcourse :)

9qBAQCDnm9bhn8-2xBbU9g.text: Underwhelmed.   The miso my girls ordered was really watery.  Not much flavor.  It took more than 20 minutes to come out...less than 1 minute before the rolls. Long menu fulfillment for a half-full restaurant.    My oceanside roll was nice. Fresh and well balanced in the ingredients. My daughter loved her simple salmon roll. I tried the Japanese pickled vegetables.  Beautiful presentation.    Other than the slow service to get the food, the front of the house service was lovely.  The waiter was accommodating and friendly.  Two hostesses checked on us several times and lovely in conversational skills and very warm countenance.    The decor is lovely with little bits of humor to discover as you walk through.  The ambiance was spoiled with an obnoxious table behind us... but that certainly isn't the restaurant's really fault... other than if perhaps they would have seated us further away.  Lol  Ad addition of a kid's menu would be nice addition if families are wanted as customers.

photos.caption: Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sake happy hour from 3 to 6 pm

SQutBuKSipq66BRG4pYE7g.text: First time in and will definitely be back. When we arrived for our 6:30 reservation the parking lot was full. Had to drive around for 10 minutes looking for a spot to park. Be warned and leave early.   Once we got in we loved the look of the place. Dark and mellow and small. We were greeted by a friendly host and given a nice table by the  window. A review of the menu shows a lot of different choices, sushi to surf and turf to rice bowls. I wanted to peruse the menu so I ordered the garlic butter seared tuna ($14) and it was awesome. Perfectly seared tuna with a spicy sauce on them. Presentation was lovely. I followed that up with an oyster shooter ($5) which is an oyster and a quail egg in yuzu juice with some spices. Was very good and I downed it in one gulp. I then ordered an array of sushi, all the staples are represented, salmon, tuna, scallops, mackerel and yellowtail. All the fish was fresh and very tasty. Finally I ordered the miso glazed salmon ($24) with mushroom and onion brown rice risotto. The fish was cooked perfectly. Very tasty and glazed lightly with miso. I found a couple bones in my fish but it was very good. The risotto not so much. It was cooked well but had little flavor. Just bland. Could have used salt but there wasn't any on the table so I just ate it. My wife had the agedashi tofu ($6) and loved it. Very tasty she asked for a spoon to finish up all the broth. Next she had the crispy rice spicy tuna ($11) and it was very good. I ate a few pieces of it myself and it was good. Crispy rice and a nice spicy tuna. Not too spicy but enough. Then she had cucumber sunomono ($5 plus $3 for crab) with crab sticks and it was very good.   Overall a great meal and well worth the parking hassle. Service was good, friendly and helpful with any questions we had.

ozZ9lAoJZH3Xu-Cr_n9I8g.text: My husband and I have never found a sushi restaurant in Vegas off strip, that we could agree on....until Pier 215.  My friend recommended it to me and we have been back once a week since then.  The fish is always fresh and the Toro is too die for. A few of my favorites are yellowtail salsa/carpaccio, crispy pork bellies, garlic butter seared tuna, beef tenderloin Tobanyaki, and of course the toro and sushi rolls they customize to our liking. They have a very diverse menu. For dessert you have to have the fried cheesecake with salted caramel ice cream! It's to do for! Emily, the manager goes above and beyond and aims to please. She can even put up with my boisterous husband lol. She makes sure everything is perfect and surprises us with new dishes to try.  The wait staff does a phenomenal job but Kevin is our favorite. His recommendations are spot on and really knows what he is doing. Both he and Emily have great personalities and do their jobs well. Give Pier 215 a try....you won't be disappointed!

ov4DVl3yNLqB-RijwhghzQ.text: Happy hour is the name of the game! Been here twice this week back to back for some $1 OYSTERS (HOLLAA BACK WOOT WOOT). Their entire selection is decent (3-4 varieties) if you're adventurous but the happy hour is under the chef's discretion. I got to try 2 types last night and man did we have a great time with the BOGO beer and half off sake. Spicy tuna rice sushi and SPICY GARLIC EDAMAME were absolutely FIYAH.  The service is attentive, knowledgeable, and personable. We enjoyed the Asian male server who kept coming back to check on us and making sure we were good.  Spent $80 and I thought happy hour was supposed to be cheap! I enjoyed the place, atmosphere, service, food... And that kept me staying and paying!  5 stars for HAPPY HOUR!

photos.caption: Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HAPPY HOUR OYSTERS WOW SO VALUE MUCH SATISFIED

YjTN41EiC9rS68TZvZpQIg.text: So delicious. They fit our party of 8 in during a busy convention week. Really trendy spot with tight decor. We enjoyed everything from the cocktails to the fois gras sushi which was a treat. If I could give a tip, share the Uni risotto. It was al dente and delightful but really rich and after a few bites it's a bit overwhelming. Crispy rice tuna was just as hood as Katsura in the SLS. Fish was fresh.

blWSR-r-c5YbevZTkZT9aw.text: One of the best meal I had in Las Vegas! This place made my day !!  This restaurant is classy and the servers are nice too. Food is fresh and tasty. Especially, oysters are really great.  If you like sea food, you need to try oysters here.  There are various dishes, so you have many options to choose :)  Such as Salmon steak , Fettuccine with fish cutlet and so on. Once I visit Las Vegas again, I'll definitely come back again.

OZqXfEdKvP3QHB8j9kU6NA.text: This place was a bit far out of the way but it tasted AMAZING. The Kimchi was even perfect. I loved getting to order sushi by the one piece instead of two pieces like most places. The service was terrific, I forgot our server's name, we went a week ago, but we had a great dinner, will definitely go again.

LFgw9UkJpO8ww3X1SE6YCw.text: Nice decor. Polite and efficient waitress. Good food, but expensive for the quantity; perhaps standard for a high end "fusion" cuisine.

0v7cdr03mVQXX8IMu0HsPw.text: First time here at Pier 215. Came with a group and enjoyed the family style ordering. The rock shrimp walnut was my favorite, the hamachi Kama didn't disappoint. Not a five star yet on since this is my first time and haven't had a chance to try out more from the menu. Otherwise, the experience was enjoying and would come back here.

ubwEoM9z26BW4DVOpWKMgg.text: happy hour menu was really good. i ordered sushi combination lunch box it was fresh!

eJOSlxW50aIZNvDySkpiag.text: Kimchi fired rice and fried Oyster also crispy Pork belly. Together with Lychee martini  that's all I remember lol  it was yummy!!

WVwV9djaF1EwWf50UoS07w.text: Pretty good and fancy. Nice local spot! Little far from the strip but I kinda liked it. Not too busy and pricy. Fish was clean and service was great. I would definitely come back!

74A9q9PKbjW0kHQnZl8RxQ.text: Absolutely delicious! My friend and I stopped in for a fairly early dinner before heading to a concert at T-Mobile. WOW! The atmosphere is just incredible, Kevin our waiter was the best and the food was phenomenal! I can't say enough about how delicious and perfect everything was. The rolls are packed they don't skimp and some of the best rolls I have ever had. I wish I lived closer so I could go more often. I will be back soon. Reasonably priced.Simply amazing. Thank you!

s4cfTU5ForqaaV8a0CEgfw.text: Been here a few times and will keep coming back! Fresh oysters, fresh fish, and great service! Naomi is awesome!

Adsy4VmHpaAqVR6Zo5VbEA.text: Our new favorite. Been frequenting since opening about a year ago. Many wonderful choices, great strip view, and lovely staff. Hard to choose a favorite dish because everything is super delicious. Try it, you'll love it!

fx1noha70bH8oeAV0-VKpQ.text: A great experience from beginning to the end. Sushi was superb and service was excellent! We ordered hamachi Kama which was ok, the beef tataki was delicious, and the oysters were fresh and goes well with the different flavored sauces. The sushi was on par with many of the top restaurants here in Vegas. It also has a lovely atmosphere if you want to bring a date over ;) All in all a 5 star experience, we will definitely be back!!

ssWy-TMFJKd5q7D0zXjL3Q.text: Service and food was more than expected. Highly recommend the Shigoku oysters. Opens up your appetite for the rest of your meal and was the best oysters I've had in awhile. Started with only a half a dozen and ended up ordering another 1/2 dozen before we closed the tab.  Cajun Shrimp vodka pasta was slightly on the salty side but that may be just a personal preference because I was the only one to notice. Hawaiian sushi roll was delicious. Garlic edamame was another great starter. Overall service was fantastic. Wish I had room to try dessert but we were stuffed and sated with everything else. Great place to watch  the sunset. Fyi... no happy hour specials.  :(

AVM33eW0Ge1BPNGppB51fw.text: So far so good. Gotta give a shout out to our server Adrian I believe  that's his name lol.  Gotta say the place is cozy and warm with an awesome view of Ikea and 215.  Started off with the crispy pork belly which is bomb then some sushi rolls. I'll let you know about the rest later once I finish eating everything.

DzLSZGpVOp8Gf35x7qyVDQ.text: Love this little spot!  Had lunch here today and will definitely be back. Their lunch menu is a great value. I ordered the sashimi combo and had miso soup, house salad w/ wonderful savory onion dressing, six pieces of nice quality sashimi and shrimp/vegetable tempura with the nicest, crispy tempura batter. Yum!!  The atmosphere is bright and hip with super friendly staff.

1BiHX4qn-u2dm03g3rNd8w.text: Went to Pier 215 that was recommended by my sister. Came in today with my fiance and was greeted by the waitress immediately, decor and feel of the restaurant feels homey and welcoming. She asked if it was our first time dining at there restaurant and immediately recommended some popular dishes they offer.First order we got was the shigoku oysters, crispy pork belly  and crispy rice tuna. I kid you not the quality and presentation of the food is to die for. Absolutely amazing. After the appetizers we ordered Uni and the sashimi sampler. To tell you the sashimi was fresh and  tasty. After the sahimi we got braised beef short ribs, absolutely good. This restaurant is Japanese,Korean and Italian fusion restaurant. They did their homework on food and feel of a restaurant. You guys should stop by and try this place out and its new!!

8Sae_tlaFeJftFOwQDcoJA.text: Very yummy sushi and good service. Only disappointment was having to ask for Tamari more than once. The decor is great but the place feels a little uptight due to the way the waitstaff is dressed and table set. It didn't feel as comfortable as going to the place I consider my regular sushi spot.

hvQosSnexm33AXsotj1hiQ.text: Best new restaurant we've tried in some time. Great service from Rochelle.  Nigiri was remarkably fresh, especially the salmon. Oysters, sashimi salad, yellowtail w/ponzu refreshing. Miso glazed salmon was cooked to perfection and very flavorful; not a fan of risotto usually, but it matched the salmon well.

5PX4HhQdi8sYCiRb7VzwAQ.text: Was recommended to try this place out and it's awesome! Everything was prepared to perfection and everything was fresh. Also a shout out to our server Adrian! He was really helpful and very friendly!

U8x3sxoomW1HORDs7iNOmA.text: First time going here and I was definitely surprised! I was craving for seafood and decided to try out their Asian Style Bouillabaisse and it was BOMB.com!!! It's a lobster based soup with a hint of spice with shrimp, mussels and added a side of lobster. Definitely a must try if you're up to trying something new! In addition, the decor of this place is beautiful! Thank you Kevin for providing us more knowledge about your menu and for providing exceptional customer service!

Ua0_Xk_MbnNDeWlFD2N89w.text: I highly recommend this place. The decor is great and the food is really good. The clam, mushrooms miso soup is a nice spin on a classic. I loved the two fifteen roll, octopus carpaccio, black tiger roll and crispy rice w spicy tuna. Another classic that they do really well is sweet garlic chili edamame...something special in their mix. The tolls are very large and portions are fantastic for sharing. Great spot on the west side conveniently located near shopping.

-zNL-_hYS0af_lSP9ZCm4w.text: 1st visit.  Very good quality food.  No complaints with service.  Chef made errors with two of our dishes.  They fixed them to our satisfaction plus served a free dessert due to those mistakes.  Will return. Sushi & Rock Shrimp Walnut stood out as our favs.

zz_b-TF8t-sQbN-lDsTAkA.text: I absolutely love this spot... Uni shots are to die for and that's why we come in weekly. The food is so fresh is unbelievable

Jo4y6QLqDi0X2fpaTQkdNw.text: Garlic butter seared tuna was to die for... came in last night and was so happy with the food. And also our server, she was very attentive and detailed oriented.

S9zyxgHAsjtNy2rjZGcVCg.text: Came for the happy hour which is daily from 3-6pm. 4 stars for nice service, venue, and fresh $6 oysters per 1/2 dozen per person! Otherwise, the other HH items we tried were just ok (spicy karage- not spicy but is saucey and fills you up, fish & chips- fries were crispy but fish was dry and probably over cooked). The Umiko roll which has a special summer price is worth trying imo, probably the best bang for your buck for rolls. I'll be back for HH for the oysters and ambiance!

1alt1NT37BCaUKsqIUvVAg.text: This is my favorite sushi spot in town! The service is always great. The rolls are fresh and flavorful. I haven't tried anything I don't like actually. The sweet garlic edamame is a MUST. Great wine selection. They also always have specials for drinks and food going on.  I also love the location, it's convenient but trendy.  Great views of the city and strip.  Desserts are also on point! The fried cheesecake is amazing.

jiQQgOobsib58VfA189zxQ.text: My wife and I were looking to try someplace new to us and came across Pier 215 on Yelp.  We made reservations on the phone and when we arrived we were seated immediately. The hostess was warm and friendly as was our server.  We both felt our server was pleasant and accommodating but may have been lacking a bit as far as attentiveness goes.  We had to look for and call her over several times, but overall she was pleasant and what she lacked the rest of the staff more than made up for. I had the seafood Asian bouillabaisse and my wife had a sushi roll.  I really enjoyed the bouillabaisse.  My wife did not enjoy her sushi roll  She rated it just ok.  She also had a "mule" drink and wondered if any alcohol was in it.   Again, it was just okay. The shrimp tempura was a big miss. It was greasy to the point you could not even taste the shrimp. Oysters were okay, though several were on the small side and for $17 for a 1/2 dozen a bit pricey. Overall we rated the service good and the food just okay. But the kicker is that if I pay north of $100 for a meal ($20 for drinks) and it's not good, I'm not going back to try something different. Too pricey for mediocre food.  Not bad, not great, but not worth another try at that price point.

E_tg3hD_1GGIGBgEh-E0qA.text: Restaurant was nicely decorated, staff was friendly. Service was attentive but not overbearing. Food, from appetizers to entrees was excellent. Menu was varied and should appeal to all. Not cheap, but not expensive for atmosphere and quality of food. We will be back.

bzXZi4HtyZhCme-id4VpIQ.text: Still 5 stars! This place is great. Even though we told them 9 people, we changed it to 12 last minute and they were more than happy to accommodate us. Service was quick and Kevin checked up on us often. And of course the food was great as always!

ijwUdw20Yr2Gk7SjcdNW3w.text: Cool to have local joints like this popping up all over town.  Cool place from the interior to the view to the patio.  Cool menu including sushi (but that's not the highlight), raw bar items, and special dishes (when we were there a squid risotto, kampachi carpaccio, and live sea scallop).  Cool selection of sakes from $6-70/bottle.  Cool deal with fair pricing: $3/piece sushi and ~$25/special.   Only lame part was the service. Our waiter seemed like he had never been a waiter before: couldn't explain the ordering to us, rarely checked in, and when I asked about the scallop dish he said "it's you know....served....like a live sea scallop"......???!!?  We definitely enjoyed our meal and I would be happy to return if in the neighborhood.

yDO_ZHaS6uuc5Zhmxkr2bQ.text: Born and raised Las Vegas native, I've eaten a lot of sushi here in town, but the Pier 215 roll is the best I've had. Better than anything on the strip. Been here multiple times and will continue to be my go to for sushi.

aNlEC7HlTE2ZVyNgi1JvEw.text: We come here every week.  It's great and it's consistent.  Love it!  Try the pork quesadilla, it's amazing!  Also highly recommend the gyoza and obviously the sushi.

OeuhW2c4xXVQQOpe70sz2A.text: definelty my new sushi spot, idk why i never came here it being across the st from me...

Tf_YTtUCu9JB3RBRJeziOw.text: I came here with my family tonight. The ambience here is industrialized. We ordered two sushi burritos, miso salmon with brown rice risotto, salmon bowl, sashimi bowl, and the hamachi Kama. Our experience here was great. We have no complaints on any of the dishes that were served. Adrian, our server, was very kind and humorous. He had great suggestions and also helped find a dish for my daughter who has a gluten and dairy allergy. (They have tamari soy sauce by the way).  If you're looking for a place to celebrate a special occasion, this place is a great place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wY4f7tWrmCnDpjeYp8H4VQ.text: The big bonus of this spot is how close it is to home, especially when I feel there aren't that many great places in the SW. I like that it's nice, yet casual and really easy to just stop in and grab a bite to eat.  One dish that I've really honed in on is their Assorted Sashimi Rice Bowl (Lunch: $13, Dinner: $14). It's a large bowl of sushi rice (or brown rice for an additional $2) with an assortment of diced sashimi and other accompaniments. I've had it on my last three visits, however, the most recent bowl was disappointing since there were a lot more "filler" ingredients than seafood - there was Sunomono and another pickled vegetable and sadly, no salmon roe! Otherwise, I've really enjoyed them and the choice of sashimi. In the future, I'm going to inquire about the selection of ingredients prior to ordering to hopefully avoid a disappointing bowl.  Crispy Rice with Spicy Tuna ($10): Soy sauce, scallion, and eel sauce. This is fantastic. There are so many crispy rice/spicy tuna dishes out there and so far, this is my favorite one. The rice is perfectly crispy with a nice interior texture and the spicy tuna is good. I also like the addition of the eel sauce as it doesn't overpower it.  Chicken Wings ($10): Sweet and Spicy Sauce or Garlic Soy Sauce. Good wings with a nice batter, plus, the sauces are delicious. They're really similar with a dominant garlic flavor and a nice spice, whereas the Sweet & Spicy have a touch more sweetness. We ordered the wings with the sauce on the side and were able to enjoy both sauces. However tasty, I wouldn't order this dish again is because it comes with FOUR small wings for an exorbitant price (It used to be priced at a more reasonable $7). Seriously though, $2/wing???  Crispy Softshell Crab ($9): Panko, lemon, tartar sauce, and honey mustard. The batter is perfect on this softshell crab; a really great preparation on a favorite.  Two Fifteen Roll ($21.50): Lobster, soft shell crab, asparagus, mango, micro cilantro, tuna, salmon, avocado, and den miso sauce. Really, really delicious specialty sushi roll. It's a bit pricey due to the ingredients (and obviously to continue the 215 theme), so it may be more of a special occasion thing, but highly recommended.  Pier Spring Roll ($11): Shrimp tempura, shrimp, crab stick, masago, spring mix, radish, cucumber, avocado, and red bell pepper in soy paper; sans rice. I really liked the flavors of this roll and enjoyed the fact that it didn't have rice. I also prefer this over their other low-carb option, the Lotus Roll, however, it appears they have recently removed the Pier Spring Roll off their menu. BOO.  Flaming Ahi Roll ($12): Seared tuna, spicy tuna, asparagus, sliced jalapeno, and garlic ponzu sauce. Not a roll I would likely order again, but it was tasty and had a good balance of heat.  I have mixed feelings about this place. I really do enjoy their Assorted Sashimi Rice Bowl and really the reason for my subsequent visits, however, I haven't loved my dining experiences. Also, their prices seem to be all over the place and that's a turnoff, especially when it's unexpected (like the chicken wings). I would definitely love to return, but the overall vibe makes me hesitant. Hopefully the next sashimi bowl will make me fall in love again.

l7HMUwRgJwP4TutCghGD8Q.text: nice sashimi menu, and sashimi/sushi combination menu. Good for dinners and couples nights.

0lap7L_QW6nEhz3n-ZkTWA.text: The sushi here was wonderful. We got great service and the ambiance helped to create a fun night. Thank you!

5zMvMHwPUCgmHmy714tEWw.text: Food is really really good.  Happen to just stumble in to this place.   But have to admit like others have said service is a little off

LiNC753tj9XZK13nuaYV7Q.text: Very good food and nice little spot over looking the 215 HWY food presentation is great and taste really good. I had the pasta and loved it definitely try it thanks

9RSsZAevpk0BiMVVmqVXGQ.text: According to Bruce in Finding Nemo, "Fish are friends, not food." But I can't agree with that, and if you can't either, please make your way to Pier 215. It's way way off The Strip but worth getting to. They take fish very seriously...as food, not friends.   We came here for lunch and ate the following:  Octopus carpaccio. Tender, subtle   Garlic Butter seated tuna. Delicate flavor. Not buttery.   Crispy pork belly. A bit dry but good flavor.   Crispy rice with spicy tuna. Delicious. Rice well done. Tuna not overly spicy.  A bit sweet. Great preparation. Our favorite.   Flaming ahi roll. We like this

iKLFa4cgQynrsry19EDh4A.text: I had high hopes for this place seeing the reviews and I thought at first maybe my expectations were set too high while in the midst of the train wreck but no. His place is just bad-bad. Not one bad but two bads. First it was my wife and my two small kids. We made a res on open table and sat pretty quickly and had a drink order taken pretty quickly. When drinks were brought we out in for our kids' food and an appetizer (chicken bowl and wings). Then we wait... about 20min later we had a couple people ask if we had our order taken, which we tell them no, and they went to go find a server. Finally the "manager?" Comes by to take our order and one of the severs take over. After we take our order we ask about the kids' meal and the app. Seems like hey forgot about both...  20min later we get part of our "sushi" (garlic/butter tuna and a roll). The"tuna" was just 6pcs tuna tataki with jap mayo sauce on it.  This was total lipstick on a pig. Dish was NOT a $14 dish and the roll was probably 4 total pcs of nigiri worth of fish... then 10-15min after the sushi dinner comes out. Such a let down THEN we get the kids' chicken  teriyaki bowl. (Insert Jackie Chan meme of WTF face). We then ask about the wings... and of course they say they're on the way. Mind you this place was MORE THAN HALF EMPTY when this train wreck was happening and a couple other tables next to us were getting orders placed and food deliver d before we ordered.   Review of the food. Sushi reminds me of end of the week sushi buffet fish. The sushi rice was overly sweet like you'd find at a Korean restaurant for Kim-Bap. Chicken wings still have feathers on them but that somehow justifies $10 for 5 wings. Do added feathers cost more? The salmon had the stringy sinew attached as did the "sweet shrimp sushi". I couldn't find a positive on this place especially given that yelp had 4.5 stars on it. I KNOW there are good sushi places around here. Makes me wonder who is dining here to rate it so high?  Gutter palettes?   Summary. This place reminds me of when Korean sushi owners opened terrible sushi restaurants in the 90's and cut every corner possible...

bMHZ8qkFjhhLCr2C-atujg.text: It was my cousins 50th birthday and she wanted to eat here at Pier 215.   David was our waiter, fantastic service!   We ordered everything on the happy hour menu.. I think our exact words were.. "one of everything please!"  There wasn't anything that we didn't like. Ohhhhh! And they have Meiomi Pinot noir. My fave wine! Happy hour was really great at Pier 215  Check out the pics of the food.... I recommend checking this place out BEFORE it gets to busy.

nHdTZmZubakkEnU5P99RIg.text: Pier 215  This Asian fusion restaurant has a wide variety of foods from seafood to steaks. So, you have many items to choose from on the menu. But it's a wonderful place to bring a date or it can be a family gathering since it's in the local area.  In my experience, I've been here twice and both times has been pleasant. The food and service are incredible! And I hope to come back soon!

urW63OgzBvFbxIKJmIGZCA.text: 500th review goes to Pier 215! I wish this was closer to my house as the happy hour menu is amazing and the food tastes even better. They have happy hour EVERYDAY from 3p-6p.  Snagged these delights off the HH menu: Garlic edamame  Fried zucchini  Spicy chicken karaage Crispy rice w/tuna  Oysters  ($6 for 1/2 dozen, 1 per person) Shrimp lovers roll  Sunset roll  I've also tried the yellowtail carpaccio, udon noodle soup, and crispy cheese cake/ caramel ice cream for dessert.   Service is super friendly & quick. The inside is very aesthetic. And the music they play is perfect!  Definitely recommend for your seafood fix! Can't wait to take babes here one day :-)

2MAJMjsgrX4cqJ1Xce1rBg.text: DEFINITION OF 5 Stars in both service AND food quality!   We ordered a spread, and everything was 5/5 stars! Wow! That never happens! This place lives up to its hype.   Seriously, order anything and it's delicious! We even ordered octopus carpaccio and it was the best dang thing. I can't even pick a favorite because it was all good!  Just do yourself a favor and GO!

EcQKpMCO3KM_5OTW73OwJg.text: So, having recently turned pescatarian for health reasons after 25 years of vegetarianism, I finally got to try out Pier 215. And wow, I was very pleasantly surprised.   I had sushi for the first time ever from another takeout restaurant and then from a grocery store and while those weren't bad, I wasn't blown away until I came to Pier 1. The fish, the rice, and other ingredients were fresh and bursting with delicious flavor.   We had the spicy tsunami roll, sunset roll, and ocean side roll. Our favorite was the tsunami roll which was spicy and delicious with a flavorful sauce. The ocean side and sunset rolls were very tasty as well. And we had the option to sub out the white rice for brown rice which we were very happy we did.   I would have taken a picture, but it was good, I couldn't stop eating, lol. Theresa was our server and she was great....very cheerful, sweet, and attentive. I could definitely see myself becoming a regular here.  :-)  P.S. If I could have one complaint, it's the music. It's young trendy lounge/nightclub music and I stopped listening to that when I was 25. I'd rather have relaxing music personally, but the food is so good, I'll have to overlook the music selection or bring headphones. :-p

F6raZlrp748Q7Raq1HtYTg.text: I have been wanting to come to Pier 215 for awhile now, the place just looks pricey overall.. but we were so wrong!!! Came here on Sunday around 5pm for dinner and it wasn't crowded, the parking lot had lots of spaces. We got seated right away. The interior design gave "the pier" vibe and the service was very good! We ordered almost everything on the happy hour menu including the Tokyo Mule. I'm a mule girl and this was absolute magic. Who would've thought to make a Moscow mule with sake?! And let's not forget about the $1 oysters per PERSON! My other half is not a fan of oysters because they're always so fishy, but these ones were SO good he had no complaints. Will definitely be back again. This might just be our new weekly dinner spot

photos.caption: Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rice crispy tuna
Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail salsa
Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef tataki

XeiVlJJ9o1bFWs-I84wYog.text: I've been hearing about Pier 215 since it first opened. I see it all the time when i go to EOS or go to Master Kim's. My friend had came up with this place after i spent all day to find a variety of stuff to suggest to her, and so we ended up here instead. LOL   Parking is always a pain here now due to how busy EOS always is and how popular Master Kim's is.   I was scheduled off at 5pm and she got off 1 hour earlier than normal so we could make it for happy hour, which was from 3-6pm daily  The restaurant is pretty nice, with lots of large windows along the edges of the restaurant. Originally we thought they were going to sit us window side but was instead in the middle, with a high divider.   The menu is small, containing only 13 items, but it was sufficient for the two of us.   Spicy Chicken Karaage - When i think karaage, i think bite size pieces of chicken deep fried topped with maybe a dry seasoning or has a side of some sort of dipping sauce. I guess it was the same idea here, except it was covered/drenched in this really sweet, mildly spicy sauce. It all sat on a bed of spring greens/lettuce.   Seafood Ceviche on belgian endive topped with avocado salsa - this was a bit depressing and not what i excepted either.   Crispy Rice w/ Spicy Tuna, eel sauce, and avocado salsa - it has been a long time since we had crispy rice, and we had long forgotten where we had last had it at. My friend ordered this and i was happy because it was something we've wanted for a long time. Overall, it was decent. I think i may prefer a different "fish" instead of spicy tuna. Not because it was bad but a play on the textures. Crispy rice is crispy on the outside but its soft on the inside. If you put another soft item on top, it lacked a bit. Maybe omit the eel sauce. LOL (why is everything sweet?)  Chef's Choice Oysters w/ horseradish and cocktail sauce. This was surprisingly the "best" of the few things we got. During happy hour, there is a deal of 1/2 dozen oysters for $6, limited 1 order per person. Small little fat and plump oysters. Not too briny. Not too creamy. It was just, clean. Maybe a kushi? maybe kumamoto?   Ocean Side Roll containing spicy tuna, avocado, cucumber topped w/ seared albacore, fried onions, and ginger garlic sauce - Essentially a simple spicy tuna roll w/ avocado and cucumber topped w/ albacore. Decent tasting roll. Theres a similar one called "Sunset" which has crab stick inside instead of albacore on top. May try that next time !   Overall, twas a good dinner with my friend. Only downside is the happy hour ends at 6pm. We love going to Soho on Jones for their happy hour. This would be a good place for us to go to if we wanna switch it up.

Some of my favorite things on the menu are the Hamachi Kama and the Asian style bouillabaisse. I also love the hojicha ice cream here.

lCVh_Ax5eP8dftDsh4SfYw.text: All of the carpaccio was amazing. I recommend trying a bit of everything just for the taste. The quality is on par with some of the restaurants by the sea. This is a gem in Rhodes Ranch.

3U_fsEqXBRU2LFP9C_qbsQ.text: I like it a lot! Why?! Because they have a vegetable sushi platter!! Woo woo! It is a chef's plate of vegetable sushi + a vegetable roll + miso soup! The miso soup isn't vegan friendly so just be ware of that! The vegetable nigiri on the plate was asparagus, avocado, yamagobo, yellow daikon, mushrooms and something else I'm not sure what vegetable it was exactly. It may have been another type of mushroom or something completely different. Lol. I have no clue. But it was all GOOD. Reminded me of the fancy Veg sushi they have at Sushi Samba!

3ONyecIXNHx3cBEOFurjmw.text: My wife and I are new to Las Vegas and are establishing our new "GoTo" list of restaurants. We had wanted to go to the "un-named" Korean restaurant in the same parking lot but were unwilling to wait two hours for a table. This turned out great for us as we checked out Pier 215. We were seated immediately. The decor was fresh and elegant. As soon as we were seated our server immediately took out drink order. These drinks never went empty after that. Before I get to the food, let me continue about the service. Kevin was phenomenal. He was thorough, friendly, informative, and seemed to know when to be there and when not to be. We could have not asked for a better server or service. This alone would have brought me back.  The food was appealing both in flavor and aesthetics. The sushi was fresh, colorful, and full of flavor.  No restaurant is perfect and the only "gripe" that could be found was with the gyoza and even that was more preference than need. The Gyoza should to be crunchy on all sides. not fried on one and steamed on the other.   This was definitely added to our "Go To" list for the future.  BTW the unnamed Korean restaurant called us with a table being available after only a 10 minute wait. There loss and OUR gain!

67_wqrvkRE82prDtfBsZsA.text: Quality wise Pier 215 by far does the best in the Durango and 215 area. Came in after work with my lady to give it a shot. We drive by it about 5 times a week since out gym is Eos Fitness.       Started of with Uni shooters even though I usually would go for the oyster shooters.. They were alright to be honest more ponzu sauce then anything. We proceeded with an order of the Taco Carpaccio, it was such a great texture not chewy like other places in town.       Next my personal favorite roll was the Flaming Ahi Roll, this is straight fire pardon my slang terms. The tatake went especially well with the asparagus. For the main course we order the Sashimi Dinner! This really let's me know how good the sushi is at an establishment. My favorites that I got were red snapper, yellowtail, and the salmon. All the bites I took fell apart deliciously in my mouth.   Probably should not have ordered anything else but saw somebody order Bao Buns with Pork belly inside. Let's just say it was worth it. Pork was very juicy with a crisp to it and buns we're steamed well.   Overall great experience! Cannot wait to come back next time me and my girl are itching for sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Never knew this plaza had a view like this. Lucky you pier 215.
Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni shooters by popular demand.

-a124soNCrALsG9nLr2ocg.text: Pier 215 keeps it real the way that Carleton in his sweater vest has street cred. Still, I assume the folks in Rhodes Ranch love it!  My love and I stopped in without reservations on a Friday night just before the dinner rush. We enjoyed everything we had here. We were hoping to enjoy one of the tasting menus, but they were not able to accommodate a pescatarian request. I thought this was odd at a place known for their sushi and seafood dishes, but we made our own selections and proceeded on.   We started with a couple Oyster and Uni Shooters with shots of sake on the side. These shooters were enjoyable, but I'm not sure that I'd order them again. After these shooters we had a couple Sushi Samplers as well as their Japanese Snapper Carpaccio. While we enjoyed a few really great pieces of nigiri in the Sushi Sampler (Madai, Seared Salmon Belly, and Chu-Toro), I think my favorite dish was the Japanese Snapper Carpaccio. I'm a sucker for yuzu truffle soy sauce and the Madai they used was an excellent way to allow these flavors to really shine through with the lighter fish.    They are using some quality ingredients here at Pier 215, and I certainly don't mind paying for those quality items, but still, I had a hard time justifying the price of the meal. You can get the same quality of fish at other spots in town for a little bit cheaper, and while Pier 215 did a good job on their execution, I still wasn't entirely sold on expediting a return visit. It may seem small, but at a price point 12% - 17% less, I'd see us stopping by more often when we want something close to home. Either that, or turn up your game and really impress us with your inventiveness and execution. I'm sure they will stay open...and stay busy in fact, but in general, I'd rather venture elsewhere.   I was sharing my experience with a friend who agreed with my assessment, and stated, "Yeah, it's great white people sushi." I nodded my head and felt like he summed up my experience rather succinctly. Great white people sushi is not a good or a bad thing, it just is what it is.

Jnnt38QTnVARR6-iEkfU7g.text: This is truly the standard by which all sushi restaurants should be compared to.  I have never had better sashimi.  My sampler included ahi tuna, yellowtail, octopus, salmon, amberjack.  This was the highest quality sushi I have ever had.  Pier 215 will be on my list everytime I visit Las Vegas.

WOfDs2CZhVeaQ88aoAPsZw.text: From small plates and entrees ranging from simple delicacies to imaginative fusions of flavor,  Pier 215 never disappoints!   The vibe when you walk in is stylishly laid back. It's a large space that is perfect for date night and large groups! The service is insanely friendly, and management takes time to welcome new faces and frequent diners (like me). Great drinks and an awesome happy hour menu from 3-6, to boot!

Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kXVIV713CS1CQeCYu06p1g.text: Went to an Oyster Bar on Sahara but the line was 40 minutes, searched Yelp and found Pier 215 which is within a few miles from my home. It had good reviews.   Sat at sushi bar, no wait, one other diner at the bar. It was Happy Hour. Ordered a large house Sake. It was ok, chilled, but not cloudy sweet which is my preference. 300ml for $9, not bad.   1/2 dozen oysters were a buck each. Ordered that. Limit of one per customer. I asked for crackers. Received lemons. Asked a different chef. He said they get "asked all the time" but don't have any.  I'd like to suggest, if you're being "asked all the time,"perhaps offering saltines or something similar would be really appreciated by your guests. Ordered about $60 of sushi. Asked chef after sushi arrived, do you have any wasabi and ginger? "Of course." I guess it isn't served along with the sushi? I don't know. Service was less than stellar. I'm accustomed to great AYCE sushi restaurants in Vegas on Spring Mountain and really high end gourmet sushi spots in LA. I'm not sure I'll return here. It's expensive, service is spotty, lots of Krab sticks in their rolls (can't stand fake crab), and had to ask for basic accompaniments. I did enjoy the 215 roll with micro greens and (surcharged fee) real crab.   Dining experience was about 1hr. Never asked if I'd enjoy more ginger, it was consumed when served, nor asked if I'd enjoy more wasabi--it was clearly empty. It's like the sushi bar guests are in a weird limbo, not much contact with the chefs and the numerous servers are always walking by quickly, most often avoiding eye contact.   Waiting for the bill, especially when a restaurant isn't busy, after a mediocre dining experience is such a pleasure.   Best parts of meal, watching the lacrosse and gymnastics championships at the bar on ESPN2! No sound but clear pic as well as the cold, fresh, tap water. They must be using a quality water filter because there's no hint of chlorine.

AOsQ_Vf0d-b3ayf-198uKA.text: I was in Vegas for a conference and met a local friend for dinner. She suggested Pier 215 because it's near her house, and one of her favorite restaurants. They have a very eclectic menu of sushi, sashimi, what they can European Asian Fusion.   I started with the cucumber salad, very light and fresh, not overly seasoned, which was a nice starter. I then had 3 pieces of tuna sashimi, which was fresh and flavorful, nice chunks of tuna.   My friend had miso soup and a nice salad with some fish (not sure which one). That wasn't quite enough for us so we had grilled zucchini and asparagus.   Our waiter was friendly and knowledgeable, ambience is strip mall, but comfortable and welcoming.

Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna sashimi
Photo of Pier 215 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cucumber salad

mhfjjBjeQB6Ttw7F3ePjrg.text: After 2 visits, I'm giving 5 stars, mainly for the excellent starters, which are half off during happy hour. You can't beat that.  Each of these is fabulous: Pork belly Octopus carpaccio  Ahi tuna poke Agadashi tofu Hot popcorn shrimp  The sushi is also fresh and delicious.  Don't miss out on this one

P3fnr_5wTAKJnitoQcnlEg.text: We enjoyed a nice dinner here on a Friday night. Parking was very, very tight. We had to park near the other end of the strip mall.    We were seated quickly (we had 6:30 reservations but I'm not sure they were necessary. There were several open tables.).   Service was very friendly, but a bit slow at times.  We had to wait a bit to get water refills, and it seemed like we would never get our check at the end. After sitting for over 15 minutes with our empty dessert plate in front of us, we finally had to flag our waiter down to request our check.    The atmosphere was very classy and could be considered romantic.  Nicely lit and not too loud.  I ordered a signature drink... The Blushing Geisha.  It was yummy but not very strong.  I couldn't taste the alcohol at all, so it was either very smooth or very weak.      All of the food was fresh and the dishes were all good, but nothing WOW.  The menu was very unique and included some Italian dishes and even fish and chips.  We enjoyed the edamame and the Pier Roll the most. The crispy spicy tuna roll and the rock shrimp walnut were good but nothing spectacular, as was the dessert we ordered...the macaron sundae.    Overall it was a good meal at a nicely appointed space.  I will probably be back someday since it's in my neighborhood, but I won't be shouting it's praises to all my friends.

9m74uE8gam-2TFST-yY35A.text: Simply amazing!  I wanted some good sushi, without having to over indulge with AYCE sushi. So this place being close to my house and bookmarked for the longest time, I finally got to try this place out.   Order:  They were having 1/2 off summer special rolls. So, I ordered a few rolls off of that. The rolls were Tsunami roll, sunset roll and light house roll. All of them were delicious.   Rock Shrimp Walnut which was really good as well. The rock shrimp walnut was battered shrimp coated with a sweet mayo glaze with walnuts of course tossed in. A must try.   Chef's Sushi Special: consisted of 10 pieces of sushi and a tuna roll. Great quality and good as well. Also comes with miso soup!  Overall, the sushi is fresh and worth the price. A definite must try.

3hjz25oNumjxUiAzsGBW3g.text: Good sushi and great food. The special was good and the sushi was fresh. Think the explanation by the sever on the sushi could be better but still great food.

_g2RS4ag0NHa7JOv2g0kzA.text: We ordered beef tenderloin tobanyaki ,Miso glazed salmon, and Asian style bouillabaisse. None of them stands out or worth the price. Beef was hard, salmon was burned, and the bouillabaisse was too salty.  The interior decoration is nice... if you came here for the environment not the food....

fadl9equGe4lPTOvNJd8-w.text: Went here for lunch. Food was great. I love the location. The restaurant is very cute and clean. Prices are good as well. I had some of their specialty rolls and they were all good. The staff was friendly and helpful, also very attentive.

njZt9smfOms3h-KEN5p0wA.text: Good food, lots of options focused on quality seafood. The vodka shrimp penne is delish as well as the crispy rice and tuna. The ambiance is lovely, great date night spot. Service is excell

FSr5QkYo8z0CXV7TNgEe0A.text: The food here is amazing. If it was food alone or just the happy hour specials I'd give them a 5/5. But I'm really confused if I was at a tapas restaurant or it was just bad service. Either way one entree was wrong and the other forgotten altogether. Ordered a Diet Coke and the hostess (not sure why she was helping the table when there was already a busser, server, and someone the server was training) brought something else. Got a ton of apologies but that's all. Ended up with half our party done by the time the other 2 entrees arrived.

UNuPpJvW9Mn2WZqBlOFPNg.text: Been meaning to try this place as it's just down the street from us.. And I'm glad we finally did. From beginning to end, the staff made it a memorable experience. Was expecting a more casual setting, but it was a "high-end" experience. The food was excellent and of great quality. The restaurant was clean and well kept. Our server Ben was very friendly and attentive to anything we needed. Very professional guy. Had the crispy pork belly, Hawaiian roll, and the Fettucine Pasta, which all were amazing! Will be back!

1Oz2Q1Pmn73xblKlhZtO1g.text: Amazing food, exceptional service!  This is our first time here and everything-from the ease of making a reservation, to the great decor and upbeat music to the impeccable FRESH food and service and cleanliness exceeded our expectations. Loved the pork belly, the kimchee rice, the crispy rice with spicy tuna, the crunchy roll, angry lobster roll were all incredible!  Too bad the black cod was not on the menu tonight but the rest of the food made up for it. Our server, Adrian, was awesome. We had the best food and the best service. We will be back!!!  A True hidden gem!

4k5OimIDp4_edRy0-V7MYg.text: Terrific pork belly taps. Huge pacific oysters. Excellent scallop with risotto. Great service. We will be back.

Euv6r-0_QrV49JdUkHbnNQ.text: Best sushi place in town. Thanks Adrian for the excellent service! We'll sure to come back!

MrIm7ecKpi_8-rL5Ehi4rg.text: I had a lunch meeting at Pier 215 and the place is really cute but the time it took for us to get our food was almost 40 minutes.  We went on a weekday at 11:30am and there was maybe 2 other customers there at the time and our food still took that long. I tried the sushi burrito and it was alright, nothing special about it. A little smaller than what I expected.

zzSU4UTMlqXoocPPdJswTQ.text: When I read this was one of the hottest new restaurants, I knew I had to try it.  It was so good!  One of the best meals I had recently.  I especially liked the Haiwaiian roll, flaming ahi roll, shrimp and scallop tobanyshi.  Adrian was a great server and recommended some of fantastic dishes to try.  Would definitely come back again!

The Cod fish in the fish and chips were small but the oysters & sashimi were fresh and great. Options for low sodium soy sauce was not presented on the table.  While ordering hot tea asked for it to be served in a "teacup" oppose to a glass jar.  Sushi chef was cool while throwing up the peace sign. Awesome music!!!

We have a young child which is mostly frowned upon to bring to a restaurant atmosphere by most people when initially greeted ( as most service staff has the stigma that parents are cheap or children will be messy), not here. The fish was incrediably fresh and the variety of speciality items and proper preparation and parings was abundantly satisfying. We love this place and can't wait to re visit!! Check it out!!

MAOuOjsEduZEVoXwCQ3_mQ.text: I've heard great things about this place and I finally got to try it, first I tried the hamachi Kama and most places in Las Vegas has really bad hamachi Kama it's either too small and they just stick it in the fryer but this place has it grilled and it's amazing, on the other hand, the fish is as fresh as it gets I worked in a sushi restaurant for a couple years and I can tell how fresh it is, especially the UNI I'm a uni lover and that's the test you can do is try the uni , if it's fresh , that means the sushi is good.   Service- the service is amazing they are very attentive and make you feel welcome, Adrian was my server and he was very polite and a hard worker. The host Jan was super welcoming and nice, I also really like the sushi chefs and the manager Sam they are a great staff   I will be back!!
